<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/25/markets-crossroads-stocks-drop-bonds-surge?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Stock Market Is Getting Weird
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/25/markets-crossroads-stocks-drop-bonds-surge" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the wall street bull wearing tie-dye, pink sunglasses, and a peace sign necklace in front of a turquoise background" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTg5L2J1bGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All three major US indexes tumbled yesterday as investors prepared for a wave of economic growth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might think that sentence needs to be fact-checked, but in fact it has zero Pinocchios. Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-25/the-economic-reopening-trade-is-changing-everything-in-markets?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explains</a> what's going on: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"From stocks to bonds and commodities, traders are moving in sync on the belief that the most ambitious vaccination campaign in history is about to supercharge economic growth and unleash price pressures that have long been dormant."</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's analyze the bond market</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Perhaps not the best intro line on Hinge, but it’s crucial for understanding what's currently happening in the stock market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors are dumping bonds, sending yields (which is your return on a bond) higher. <em>Much </em>higher. This month alone, the yield on the 10-year Treasury note has gained the most in four years. Yesterday, it touched a one-year high <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/25/us-bonds-treasury-yields-rise-ahead-of-fourth-quarter-gdp-update.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">above 1.6%</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rising yields are spooking the stock market for a couple reasons:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It shows that investors are generally </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/23/worried-inflation-short-answer-probably-not?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worried about inflation</a></span><span> (whether they should be or not). Remember, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said this week he wasn't concerned that inflation would spiral out of control.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The more a bond yields, the more it competes with stocks. Yesterday, the yield on the 10-year note briefly surpassed what's known as the S&P's "</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/25/stocks-just-got-some-new-competition-from-bonds-as-10-year-rate-tops-dividend-yield.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dividend yield</a></span><span>," a threshold investors use to measure the relative attractiveness of stocks vs. bonds. Right now, it's a tight contest. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tech stocks are getting hit especially hard</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shares in companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and Tesla, all of which thrived at the height of the pandemic, are becoming less attractive in this brave new stock market world. "Value" stocks like utilities, which may have less growth potential than a high-flying software company but are also less risky, are gaining more favor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some perspective before we move on: </strong>The Dow hit a record high on Wednesday, and the S&P is less than 3% below its all-time high.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/25/costco-raises-minimum-wage-16?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Costco’s Sweet 16
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/25/costco-raises-minimum-wage-16" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photo of the front of a Costco store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTg4L2Nvc3Rjby5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Costco</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Costco CEO Craig Jelinek said his company is <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/25/business/costco-minimum-wage-workers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bumping starting pay</a> to $16/hour—$1 more than Target, Best Buy, and Amazon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Costco has consistently paid employees more than retail rivals. Its 180,000 US workers earn an average wage of $24/hour and have received $2/hour hazard pay throughout the pandemic.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"This isn't altruism," Jelinek said. "It helps in the long run by minimizing turnover, maximizing employee productivity, commitment, and loyalty."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your friendly neighborhood Amazon, which implemented a $15/hour min. wage in 2018, recently <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/y3gj87/why-amazon-is-flooding-the-country-with-dollar15-minimum-wage-ads?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">embarked on</a> a PR blitz for a $15 federal minimum wage. Raising pay has helped the company recruit and pressure competitors, particularly Walmart, which just last week <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/walmart-raises-wages-mcdonalds-links-exec-pay-diversity-targets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upped</a> wages for 425,000 employees. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This conversation is also happening at the highest levels of government. Yesterday, Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/senate-waits-for-minimum-wage-ruling-from-parliamentarian-11614266273?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> a $15 federal minimum wage should not move through the budget reconciliation process being used to push President Biden's proposed stimulus package forward.  </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Financial Times <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1eaa8d8d-a50c-44e9-81ac-84d298edfcdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that upscale members' club Soho House plans to go public in New York as early as next month at a reported valuation of up to $3 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The IPO is kinda like Soho House itself—we all poke fun at its upper-crust, jet-set brand, right up until we're two Sancerres deep and considering a mortgage refinance to cover a membership. Which is to say, SH is looking pretty good right now, as some travel-related stocks surge in anticipation of an industry rebound when Covid-19 vaccines roll out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shares in the world's largest hotelier, Marriott, are up 26% since the beginning of February, and CEO Tony Capuano said he's optimistic about the return of not just leisure travel, but business travel, which is key for the industry. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airbnb is up over 40% since its December IPO—and it crushed revenue estimates in Q4.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>We’re still in a global pandemic, and Soho House faces serious headwinds, despite recent enthusiasm for its sector. It had to lay off 1,000 employees during the pandemic and has been using a workaround called "payment in kind" to diminish interest payments to creditors. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you're one of the increasing number of Americans working in the gig economy, you know that filing your taxes is more frustrating than untangling headphone wires. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help, we've compiled a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">comprehensive tax guide</a> that includes:</p>

<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Profiles of freelancers who've been there and done that</span></li>

</ul>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll three major US indexes tumbled yesterday as investors prepared for a wave of economic growth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might think that sentence needs to be fact-checked, but in fact it has zero Pinocchios. Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-25/the-economic-reopening-trade-is-changing-everything-in-markets?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplains\u003c/a\u003e what's going on: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"From stocks to bonds and commodities, traders are moving in sync on the belief that the most ambitious vaccination campaign in history is about to supercharge economic growth and unleash price pressures that have long been dormant.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's analyze the bond market\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePerhaps not the best intro line on Hinge, but it’s crucial for understanding what's currently happening in the stock market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors are dumping bonds, sending yields (which is your return on a bond) higher. \u003cem\u003eMuch \u003c/em\u003ehigher. This month alone, the yield on the 10-year Treasury note has gained the most in four years. Yesterday, it touched a one-year high \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/25/us-bonds-treasury-yields-rise-ahead-of-fourth-quarter-gdp-update.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabove 1.6%\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRising yields are spooking the stock market for a couple reasons:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt shows that investors are generally \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/23/worried-inflation-short-answer-probably-not?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworried about inflation\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (whether they should be or not). Remember, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said this week he wasn't concerned that inflation would spiral out of control.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe more a bond yields, the more it competes with stocks. Yesterday, the yield on the 10-year note briefly surpassed what's known as the S\u0026P's \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/25/stocks-just-got-some-new-competition-from-bonds-as-10-year-rate-tops-dividend-yield.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edividend yield\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,\" a threshold investors use to measure the relative attractiveness of stocks vs. bonds. Right now, it's a tight contest. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTech stocks are getting hit especially hard\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShares in companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and Tesla, all of which thrived at the height of the pandemic, are becoming less attractive in this brave new stock market world. \"Value\" stocks like utilities, which may have less growth potential than a high-flying software company but are also less risky, are gaining more favor.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome perspective before we move on: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Dow hit a record high on Wednesday, and the S\u0026P is less than 3% below its all-time high.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Costco CEO Craig Jelinek said his company is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/25/business/costco-minimum-wage-workers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebumping starting pay\u003c/a\u003e to $16/hour—$1 more than Target, Best Buy, and Amazon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCostco has consistently paid employees more than retail rivals. Its 180,000 US workers earn an average wage of $24/hour and have received $2/hour hazard pay throughout the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"This isn't altruism,\" Jelinek said. \"It helps in the long run by minimizing turnover, maximizing employee productivity, commitment, and loyalty.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour friendly neighborhood Amazon, which implemented a $15/hour min. wage in 2018, recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/y3gj87/why-amazon-is-flooding-the-country-with-dollar15-minimum-wage-ads?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eembarked on\u003c/a\u003e a PR blitz for a $15 federal minimum wage. Raising pay has helped the company recruit and pressure competitors, particularly Walmart, which just last week \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/walmart-raises-wages-mcdonalds-links-exec-pay-diversity-targets?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupped\u003c/a\u003e wages for 425,000 employees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis conversation is also happening at the highest levels of government. Yesterday, Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/senate-waits-for-minimum-wage-ruling-from-parliamentarian-11614266273?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e a $15 federal minimum wage should not move through the budget reconciliation process being used to push President Biden's proposed stimulus package forward.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Which is to say, SH is looking pretty good right now, as some travel-related stocks surge in anticipation of an industry rebound when Covid-19 vaccines roll out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares in the world's largest hotelier, Marriott, are up 26% since the beginning of February, and CEO Tony Capuano said he's optimistic about the return of not just leisure travel, but business travel, which is key for the industry. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirbnb is up over 40% since its December IPO—and it crushed revenue estimates in Q4.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eWe’re still in a global pandemic, and Soho House faces serious headwinds, despite recent enthusiasm for its sector.
